message: Hi Bob, I'm excited to offer you this incredible product! I think it's a game-changer, and I'm confident you'll love it. I'm willing to sell it to you for $750000. This is a great deal, considering its true value is significantly higher. What do you think?
I'm interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $600000. I'm willing to pay that price for it. What do you think?

Thanks for your offer, Bob! I understand you're looking for a good deal, but I'm afraid $600000 is a bit too low for me. I'm willing to meet you halfway and offer it to you for $700000. This is a great compromise, considering the product's true value. What do you think?
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I'm still a bit above $700000. I'm willing to pay $650000 for the product. Can we meet at this price?

I understand you're still looking for a good deal, Bob. I'm willing to make one more concession. I can offer it to you for $675000. This is as low as I'm willing to go, considering the product's value. What do you think?
I appreciate your willingness to make one more concession, Alice. I'm willing to pay $660000 for the product. Can we meet at this price?

I'm getting close to my minimum price, Bob. I can offer it to you for $670000. This is my final concession. If you're willing to meet me at this price, I'll consider it a done deal. What do you think?

I appreciate your final concession, Alice, but I'm still not convinced that $670000 is the right price for me. I'm willing to meet you halfway between $670000 and $660000, so I'll offer $665000. Can we meet at this price?

I'm sorry, Bob, but I've already gone as low as I can. I'm not willing to go any lower than $670000. I think this is a fair price considering the product's value. If you're not willing to meet me at this price, I'm afraid I'll have to consider other options. What do you think?
